com.craftfire.commons.yaml
Class YamlNode

java.lang.Object
  com.craftfire.commons.util.AbstractValueHolder
      com.craftfire.commons.yaml.YamlNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
ValueHolder
public class YamlNode
extends AbstractValueHolder

A class for yaml nodes.

Checks if this node's children has been loaded.

Only map or list nodes can be resolved.

Returns:
true if resolved, false otherwise

getChild

public YamlNode getChild(String name)
                  throws YamlException
Returns a child node of this node with specified name.

Only map nodes can look up children by name.

Parameters:
name - name of the child node
Returns:
the child, or null if doesn't exist
Throws:
YamlException - if the node is not a map

getChild

public YamlNode getChild(String name,
                         boolean add)
                  throws YamlException
Returns a child node of this node with specified name.

Only map nodes can look up children by name.

If the child doesn't exist, and add is true, then creates one. If the node is null, and attempting to create the child, the node will be turned into a map.

Parameters:
name - name of the child node
add - weather or not create the child if doesn't exist
Returns:
the child, or null if doesn't exist and not being created
Throws:
YamlException - if the node is not a map and not null

hasChild

public boolean hasChild(String name)
Checks if the node has a child node with specified name.

Only map nodes can look up children by name. For other types of nodes will always return false.

Parameters:
name - name of the child node
Returns:
true if has, false otherwise

getChildrenMap

public Map<String,YamlNode> getChildrenMap()
                                    throws YamlException
Returns map of child nodes of this map node.

Returns:
a map of child nodes
Throws:
YamlException - if the node is not a map

getChildrenList

public List<YamlNode> getChildrenList()
                               throws YamlException
Returns map of child nodes of this list node or map node.

Returns:
a list of child nodes
Throws:
YamlException - if the node is a scalar

addChild

public YamlNode addChild(Object value)
                  throws YamlException
Adds a nameless child node to this node.

Adding nameless children works only for list nodes.

If this node is null, it will be turned into a list node.

Parameters:
value - value of the new node
Returns:
the added node
Throws:
YamlException - if this node is not a list

addChild

public YamlNode addChild(String name,
                         Object value)
                  throws YamlException
Adds a child node to this node.

Adding child nodes doesn't work for scalar nodes.

If the node is a map, and a child with specified name already exists, it will be overriden.

If this node is null, it will be turned into a map node, or list node if the name is empty.

Parameters:
name - name of the new node
value - value of the new node
Returns:
the added node
Throws:
YamlException - if this node is a non-null scalar or the name is empty and the node is not a list

addChild

public YamlNode addChild(YamlNode node)
                  throws YamlException
Adds specified node as a child node of this node.

Adding child nodes doesn't work for scalar nodes.

If the node is a map, and a child with the same name already exists, it will be overriden. Note that a copy of specified node will be added, not the node itself.

If this node is null, it will be turned into a map node, or list node if the name is empty.

Parameters:
node - the node to be added
Returns:
a copy of specified node, being a child of this node
Throws:
YamlException - if this node is a non-null scalar or the name of the specified node is empty and this node is not a list

addChildren

public void addChildren(YamlNode... nodes)
                 throws YamlException
Adds specified nodes as child nodes of this node.

Adding child nodes doesn't work for scalar nodes.

If the node is a map, and a child with the same name already exists, it will be overriden. Note that a copy of specified nodes will be added, not the nodes themselves.

If this node is null, it will be turned into a map node.

Parameters:
nodes - nodes to be added
Throws:
YamlException - if this node is a non-null scalar, or this node is not a list and one of nodes has empty name

addChildren

public void addChildren(Map<?,?> map)
                 throws YamlException
Adds all entries of specified map as new child nodes of this node.

Adding child nodes doesn't work for scalar nodes.

If the node is a map, and a child with the same name already exists, it will be overriden.

If this node is null, it will be turned into a map node.

Parameters:
map - the map
Throws:
YamlException - if this node is a non-null scalar, or this node is not a list and the map has empty text keys

addChildren

public void addChildren(Collection<?> collection)
                 throws YamlException
Adds all elements of specified collection as new child nodes of this list node.

If this node is null, it will be turned into a list node.

Parameters:
collection - the collection
Throws:
YamlException - if this node is not a list node and not null

getChildrenCount

public int getChildrenCount()
Returns number of children of the node.

Returns:
number of children

getFinalNodeList

public List<YamlNode> getFinalNodeList()
Returns list of final (scalar) nodes among descendants of this node

Returns:
list of final nodes

getFinalNodeCount

public int getFinalNodeCount()
Returns number of final (scalar) nodes among descendants of this node

Returns:
number of final nodes

removeChild

public YamlNode removeChild(String name)
Removes a child node with specified name from this node's children.

Parameters:
name - name of the child to remove
Returns:
the removed child, or null if didn't remove anything

removeChild

public YamlNode removeChild(YamlNode node)
Removes specified child node from this node's children.

Parameters:
node - the node to remove
Returns:
node if removed, or null if not this node's child

removeAllChildren

public void removeAllChildren()
Removes all children of the node.

setValue

public void setValue(Object value)
Sets value of the node to specified value, and removes children, if any.

Parameters:
value - the value

dump

public Object dump()
Dumps the node with all children to a standard JRE class (lie Map, List, or Integer), which can be then dumped to file (eg. with SnakeYaml).

Returns:
dumped node

getNode

public YamlNode getNode(String... path)
                 throws YamlException
Returns a descendant node of this node with given path (relative to this node).

Parameters:
path - list of path elements of the descendant node
Returns:
the node with specified path, or null if not found
Throws:
YamlException - if one of the nodes in the path is a scalar or list node

getNode

public YamlNode getNode(boolean add,
                        String... path)
                 throws YamlException
Returns a descendant node of this node with given path (relative to this node).

If any the nodes in path don't exist, and add is true, then creates them. If the node is null, and attempting to create the child, the node will be turned into a map.

Parameters:
add - weather or not create the node if doesn't exist
path - list of path elements of the descendant node
Returns:
the descendant node, or null if doesn't exist and not being created
Throws:
YamlException - if any node in the path is not a map and not null

getNode

public YamlNode getNode(String path)
                 throws YamlException
Returns a descendant node of this node with given path (relative to this node).

Parameters:
path - path of the descendant node, separated with this node's YamlManager's path separator
Returns:
the node with specified path, or null if not found
Throws:
YamlException - if one of the nodes in the path is a scalar or list node

getNode

public YamlNode getNode(String path,
                        boolean add)
                 throws YamlException
Returns a descendant node of this node with given path (relative to this node).

If any the nodes in path don't exist, and add is true, then creates them. If the node is null, and attempting to create the child, the node will be turned into a map.

Parameters:
path - path of the descendant node, separated with this node's YamlManager's path separator
add - weather or not create the node if doesn't exist
Returns:
the descendant node, or null if doesn't exist and not being created
Throws:
YamlException - if any node in the path is not a map and not null

path - path elements of the descendant node
Returns:
true if has, false otherwise
